website_summaries.verdict: A pretty corded appliance for legs and body.
pros: easily stash it in your overnight bag
cons: Head contains only 21 tweezers (a smaller number than some competitors)

customer_reviews.title: There are easier ways to torture yourself
customer_reviews.text: Holy heck there are easier ways to torture yourself, if that’s what you’re into. I bought this thinking, it can’t possibly hurt worse than waxing. But alas, I was wrong. I decided test it out on my leg first and glad was I that I did. I shudder to think what this little shredder would have done to my lady parts. I think I’ll stick with waxing, thank you very much.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Violent Bulldozer
customer_reviews.text: This is for women right? Not a weedwacker? My gosh idk if epilators are supposed to be this violent. This thing is like a very violent aggressive weedwacker that'll rip your hairs out like it doesn't care and at a surprise. When I run it over my skin a few times it will rip the hair out unexpectedly. That makes it even worse and hurt more. It's also extremely loud like a weedwacker. Only one word: violent.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: While it worked I loved it. Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this product one star because it just died after only having it for 5 months. It won't do anything, just dead. I probably used it a total of 10 t0 12 times during that period and I used it correctly, cleaned correctly. No abuse. While it worked I loved it. Easy to use, one just needs to be aware of what you're doing. But it died so I can't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: R56redmond

customer_reviews.title: I love this little thing
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this right after I new exist, it really hurts fot me , because I have a lot of hair, so I did it by sections, I love the final results
customer_reviews.author: Mariely Arias

customer_reviews.title: Histamine bumps with every use
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely cannot recommend this epilator. Every time I use this I develop large histamine bumps that take days just to reduce to bruises, leaving me wearing long pants to hide the damage. I also have a Braun Epi-silk 9 and never have issues when I use it (used dry), but every time I try this Philips epilator I get a fresh round of histamine bumps. It's not worth the discomfort, bumps, or bruising. If you have even slightly sensitive skin just go for something better.
customer_reviews.author: crazymama

customer_reviews.title: Best hair removal system on the market
customer_reviews.text: I have been using a hair removal product like this for years. I needed something new. Read all the reviews and watched you tube on the one. I do remove hair off my face and this produce seemed like it would be perfect. AND IT DID. I have never had the hair removed off my face so well. I used it the day I got it and can’t believe the difference the smallest hairs were removed.LOVE IT By the way. I’m 68 yrs old
customer_reviews.author: grandma8

customer_reviews.title: Medieval torture device that doesn’t work!
customer_reviews.text: I agree with others I think tattoos hurt less than using this thing. It stings like hell, it would hurt less to pluck each individual hair. It also doesn’t do what it says! I followed exact directions, exfoliated every day, and this thing literally is just a very very painful way of shaving. The hairs were not plucked- I could see them and they’re still there just very short. I’ll be returning this item and I’m so bummed!
customer_reviews.author: hklep

customer_reviews.title: Took my skin and left
customer_reviews.text: If I could give it negative stars, I would. I did lots of research before buying and using this product. Read reviews, watched videos, and read the instructions multiple times. I was so pumped for it to arrive, and decided to give it a go. Holy hell, it was painful. I figured it was the cost of smooth skin, and kept going. Now I’m left with scabby, red patches all over where it removed my skin and left the hair. Thank god we are under stay at home orders because I couldn’t leave the house like this.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Kramer

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Do not waste your time with this. In my opinion buy a better one. Yes this is cost efficient but it doesn't do what it's supposed to do. I bought this thing back in February the only thing that it actually does, is shave the hair off. Yes it does tweeze some of the hair off but not the way it's advertised. I never got smooth legs from using this device. I used it with and without the safety cap same result with both. I use it daily. I have dark coarse hair. Don't waste your money buy a better device. If I could give it zero stars I would.
customer_reviews.author: BR

customer_reviews.title: The Philips Epilator Works with Practice
customer_reviews.text: The Philips epilator works, but it takes practice and patience. Be prepared for the pain, but I believe it is worth it. After my first use, I left patches of hair on my legs. The first use was painful for me, but I manage the pain better now. Holding the device at the correct angle is crucial for good hair removal. I learned what works with practice. I can go for days, if not weeks, without noticeable hair growth. I use this before showering as the heat and water seem to relieve the redness and irritation. I recommend applying lotion after use at the very least.
customer_reviews.author: A. Ski

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: This epilator should be taken off the market. It breaks hairs off on your legs in places. It does not remove them by the root. Terrible ingrown hairs because of that. The top piece always comes off. Poorly made, mine already has a short in the cord too. It has only been used maybe 8 or 9 times. This is the crummiest epilator I have ever used.
customer_reviews.author: diezel1

customer_reviews.title: Pain Level Decreases!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first epilator and I love it! The device fits perfectly in my small hand and the cord is fairly long. It works phenomenally and pulls the hair from the root. It was pretty painful at first, but it definitely got better as the hair became thinner! I did get some ingrown hairs, as it warns, but keep them at bay with a whizker brush. The trickiest part might be waiting until they grow long enough again to epilate! Update: I've used this for over 1 month and the hair grows back quickly again and I've noticed a massive influx of ingrown hairs and am unable to keep them at bay.
customer_reviews.author: JBui

customer_reviews.title: Thank goodness it’s not the Epilady from the 1980s
customer_reviews.text: I have dark thick hair everywhere. I started with the original Epilady as a teen but couldn’t tolerate it so I went to wax exclusively. Decades later I’ve grown to hate waxing it’s messy at home and is expensive at the salon. I just did both my lower legs in maybe 30min and got the same results. Ive never had a service that didn’t leave some hair some where. This did too and it’s fine. It was darn near painless. It’s more of a prickly feeling for me during and after. Cannot wait to try other areas. I can rinse / wipe this thing clean instead of scrape, scrub, or oil down a wax kit to clean. I’m cautiously optimistic.
customer_reviews.author: luvnconvenience

customer_reviews.title: Where has this been all my life??
customer_reviews.text: Shoot, wrote a whole review and it disappeared. Anyway, this thing is great! I have very little body hair, and only needed it for my lower legs. I love the sensation of getting my lower legs waxed, but it’s expensive, so I haven’t done it in almost 20 years. Hate shaving, so I stopped for 3 months and let my hair grow. Even though my hair is sparse, I didn’t like the look. So I decided to try this. Call me crazy, but I love the sensation!! It’s not painful (to me), it feels satisfying, like scratching an itch. Wish I had this back when I was a kid (I’m 41 now). Well, better late than never!
customer_reviews.author: A. Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money on an expensive epilator, but this!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly I purchased an epilator worth over $300 + that my ex damaged. So I thought I'd buy a cheap version, no regrets!! It does the same job. You'd want to use this device after you wax or if you have fine hair. Using after a shave would be the worst way to go. All those bits of hair left after you wax, that's the perfect time to use!! Or even so you might not need to wax again and continue to use this epilator. Delivery was good too, only thing would've been nice, if it came with a case and a mini brush like most epilators come with. Nevertheless, I love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Julie Jones

customer_reviews.title: Works but ....
customer_reviews.text: This does the job sorta. The pros are that this doesn't hurt. I've used the emjoi before and have literally cried. With this, I felt no pain whatsoever. The reason why I gave this 3 stars is that unless the hair is long it doesn't do a good job catching shorter hairs. However, even with hairs that are long enough the hair grew back weird. It took about a week for the hair to grow back but when it did oh my, the area was inflamed and it made me itch. Again, not the fault of the device but it doesn't grow back "cute" it grows back coarser. So I would say skip this one.
customer_reviews.author: kiki

customer_reviews.title: Affordable but time consuming
customer_reviews.text: Used for thin asian hair and the feeling is akin to being mildly electrocuted. Gets easy once you’re in the groove and numb to the pain but at that point, I feel like this thing takes too long. Overall would prefer waxing over this but this is way more cost effective if you’ve got the time and patience. Not for faint of heart, my SO nearly cried. PRO: affordable and compact. CON: takes too long to cover everywhere VERDICT: if you can pluck without wincing in pain, you can use this. It’s true what they say, women have higher pain tolerance than men.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Lu

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this!!!
customer_reviews.text: *UPDATE* 2 weeks after I used this..90% of my hair is ingrown. My legs are nothing but thousands of red bumps with hair stuck under the skin. I can't even shave yet. I will never use this again. $40 straight in the trash. So very painful! I really wanted this to work. I have super thick and dark hair that feels more like cactus needles than hair. This epilator rips out about 2/3 of the hair and breaks the rest. So if I rub my leg it's still completely prickly, which means I still have to shave anyway. Not to mention it leaves your legs red and bumpy and they feel like they are completely on fire.
customer_reviews.author: h8pigs

customer_reviews.title: Still kicking after 6 years
customer_reviews.text: I've had my device for 6 years now and it still works great, which is pretty solid for a $35 device. Depending on the location, the pain and level of irritation varies. My arms didn't hurt or get irritated much at all. However, my legs required some teeth-gritting and a glass of wine the first few times. It gets easier and less painful over time, barely feel it on my legs now. I do get angry red bumps where there is coarse hair removed (legs) but I just apply a little aloe and it's gone in a couple of hours - just don't plan to do this right before going out with bare legs.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Hughes

customer_reviews.title: An Actual Torture Device
customer_reviews.text: My hairy mom uses this and gave me the unsolicited advice that I should really get one as well. So of course I did. I've tried it on legs, arms, and facial hair. Here's the thing though: this is torture. Actual torture. It's waxing in slow motion, with the sound of a high-powered drill. SO. FREAKING. LOUD. It's painful, slow, and inefficient. It misses a lot and the hair already has to be pretty long to use it, so it's impractical. I end up spending nearly as much time plucking anyway. That said, I still use it occasionally. What won't women do for temporary hairlessness? Dumb.
customer_reviews.author: Average Shmoe

customer_reviews.title: Irritated skin a week later
customer_reviews.text: Ive been wanting one of these forever and I thought I’d “get used to” the pain but I had to stop after just a couple strips. I told myself I’d try again later but after a week, my legs STILL irritated in the spots I did go over. I have red bumps and my skin is all bumpy (not able to see in the photos). I DO NOT HAVE SENSITIVE SKIN and I’ve had 3 babies without pain medication. THIS THING HURTS so bad I couldn’t tolerate it. I don’t know if it’s because it’s a cheaper version or what but I REALLY wanted to love it. I wish I could return it.
customer_reviews.author: KBM26

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I like it. I've had a Philips epilator for 4 years, I used it quite a lot so it eventually broke. So I've decided to buy a new epilator from the same company. It's newer, it's faster, now it takes me less time to get the job done. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Alie Velilyaeva & Yunis Sumaliyev

customer_reviews.title: it was great. You have to be careful not to let ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 5 years ago and the cord is fraying now so it's no longer working. Until then, though, it was great. You have to be careful not to let it pinch your skin if you do underarms or bikini area. It removes most hair, so it works well. You get used to the pain and it no longer hurts too much after awhile. If you don't remove the head and clean it, the bacteria might build up causing some pretty nasty giant pimple-like sores. I don't know how you're supposed to clean it but I'll dip a toothbrush in rubbing alcohol and brush this thing clean once a week or so.
customer_reviews.author: A.B.

customer_reviews.title: This is a torture device don’t buy this and wax instead
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product. I am an esthetician and do body waxing for a living. I decided I would like to try an epilator to try to use on myself in place of waxing. This is absolutely the most horrible excruciating pain for absolutely no purpose. It’s basically a shaver that feels like it’s ripping your skin off. No follicles were removed at all and it is like I just tortured myself to shave my hair. I have visible stubble left everywhere. This is the worst product and torture I’ve ever endured with “hair removal” there isn’t a substitute for waxing. This is horrible don’t waste your money. Sent back immediately
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: The first time you use it feels like you are being electrocuted.
customer_reviews.text: The first time was really painful. It felt like an electric shock every time a hair was pulled. I had let mine grow out for two weeks to get the full effect. (It might be better to have shorter hairs) Now I do maintenance and it is not bad. It think that the noise was also intimidating at first and you get used to that as well. NOTE it does say it is for legs only so whoever got the razor bumps on their face was warned. It doesn't do as well with the lighter, and softer hairs, but all-in-all I really like not having to shave every two to three days.
customer_reviews.author: Hazelreeds

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: First time user here, I wish I would have taken before and after photos. My skin feels sooo smooth!!!!! I used it on my under arms and legs, it was quite painful but the pain is suppose to lessen with each use as the hair's grow back softer and thinner. I suffer from "strawberry legs" And I bought this product just in time for the warm weather!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: god-send
customer_reviews.text: this thing is amazing. I have super sensitive skin and can't afford to wax all the time so decided to try epilating and I'm never going back. it took a couple tries to find the epilator for me but this is the one and I'm positive its going to last me a long time. I accidentally ordered two and just gave the second one to my sister who also loves it. I even use it on parts of my face, it's definitely more painful there because of the thinner skin but a couple Advil before I epilate help reduce the pain. you can also try icing the area to numb it a bit. great product
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Castillo

customer_reviews.title: Good hair removal tool
customer_reviews.text: Not painless. More sensitive on fine hairs personally. What I love about this is that it can get even the shortest hairs. My problem with waxing is the mess and that half my hairs won’t be removed because of uneven growth. This gets most of the hair. But what is missed can be easily done the next day. Great value. The cost is less than one leg wax. I have super thick hair and really sensitive skin, so shaving gets really painful. I bought this a couple years ago and I still use it off and on and am happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: kayla

customer_reviews.title: Painless and it works!
customer_reviews.text: I used it for the first time on my legs this week and I LOVED IT! I usually use hair removal cream and tweezers. But this epilator does the job quick and it’s chemical free. I was treating it like a razor at first, but I recommend gliding it across the skin slowly so it can actually do its job properly . As recommended, I used it after I shower and the process wasn’t painful. It did sting a little, but it wasn’t too bad. For sanitation purposes, I rinsed it with water and rubbing alcohol before and after use. There weren’t any skin irritations, but I applied some lotion afterwards anyways to help sooth it out.
customer_reviews.author: Yume

customer_reviews.title: Works great but beware- it is painful
customer_reviews.text: So the only reason I’m not giving it 5 stars is because it is a love/hate relationship. Like it really works, it plucks your hairs out BUT this HURTS. Idk what to tell ya, if you wanna be smooth for a solid 2+ weeks AND are okay with putting yourself through 15-30 min of torture then this is the product for you. If you don’t want to be hurt, don’t buy it. Honestly though this is a great price and waxing is too messy to do yourself and still too painful and expensive if someone else is doing it for you. This product is easy to use and works, again, just painful lol.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Worked wonders for me (mtf trans)
customer_reviews.text: This thing is an absolute godsend! I’m a transwoman who has had to shave my face every day and body every three days. I have coarse hair on my legs and moderately dense hair on my torso and arms. This epilator does a wonderful job removing all of it. It doesn’t hurt that bad, the most painful part for me was doing the back of my legs, but it was tolerable.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Year and a half, going strong.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this epilator for a year and a half. It's starting to sound like a tractor, but still working great! My wax lady asked if I found someone else. I use it on my legs, full downstairs, face, and armpits (it's washable). The cord is long enough to reach across my bathroom so that hasn't been an issue. I love this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I’ll stick with razor blades
customer_reviews.text: Maybe it works fine with other people, but I couldn’t stand to use it anymore. I took a bath to ease the hairs and smoothen my legs, towel dried my legs, then attempted to shave them, it was just too uncomfortable though. It stings as it’s yanking my hairs out, it irritated my skin making it red and caused strawberry dots from the plucking of hairs. I tried to continue hoping I would get used to it or it was a trial and error on the angle I was holding it at, but I just couldn’t finish my leg, I ended up shaving it with a manual razor.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: I just received this item last night. I was really excited for it to come and had been researching them for quite some time. I pulled it out and read the instructions which said "Do not use if you're prone to ingrown hairs." Well, I was kind of sad that the description on Amazon didn't say anything about that. Needless to say, I am returning this item. But, I think if you're looking for one and aren't prone to ingrown hairs that this product would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Compact yet powerful epilator
customer_reviews.text: We moved from overseas and my wife needed a new epilator since the old one didnt work well with the wall-plug here in the US. We chose the Philips HP6401 mostly because of its compact size affordible price and trusted brand. She used it already several times while i can't say she enjoyed it (who does?) she confirmed that this epilator works well and it was a good choice. We even found some nice hard-case here on Amazon, but that is for another review (though highly recommended for storage).
customer_reviews.author: Janos Jaksa

customer_reviews.title: It does seam to do a better job on my underarms and I will keep using ...
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so I have tried this out on my legs a few times. It does leave hair behind and does break some instead of pulling it out. Even after going over the same spot multiple times, there was still some hair. The directions say that it is for legs only, but I tried it on my underarms as well. It does seam to do a better job on my underarms and I will keep using it just for that. It’s not a bad product to get if you are not sure about epilating and if you can tolerate the pain. I am planning on buying a better more efficient one in the future.
customer_reviews.author: A. Baro

customer_reviews.title: Good for beginners
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this because I was interested in stipulating versus other hair removal techniques. It's small and portable. The only downside is that it must be plugged in to operate (no battery storage) so it can't be used "everywhere" but not inconvenient enough to reduce rating. Some notes about epilation in general: Epilating does hurt (at least initially) but I found it to be less painful than waxing. Skin preparation is very important. I advise exfoliating your skin prior to using the epilator. The hair is removed much easier.
customer_reviews.author: DCWatcher

customer_reviews.title: Great for unwanted facial hair from PCOS
customer_reviews.text: I have PCOS, and this has worked wonders for my facial hair. After having it for several months I can go 2 weeks without using it. It does sting as it is pulling the hairs from the root and quite a few at once, but it’s really worth it. I like this one because you don’t have to charge it. The best thing I’ve bought for my unwanted facial hair.
customer_reviews.author: AJD

customer_reviews.title: Nice epilator
customer_reviews.text: This is my third epilator. The first one I loved but it had a rechargable battery and didn't run plugged in - and the battery died after a year. The second one I bought based on reviews and the desire to have a plugged in model to avoid battery issues. It had a smaller head and just didn't catch the hairs. I've been using this one for just over 3 months now and love it. It grabs the hairs on a single pass, isn't too painful, and is corded. I'm very happy with it and hope to be able to use it for a long time
customer_reviews.author: Tandem

customer_reviews.title: Worked
customer_reviews.text: I've never used one before. I used to have very thick leg and arm hair. After regularly using a some personal lazor and hair burning appliances for a couple years, it is very light now. And I would try to pick them out with tweezers in between shaving. Rather than continuing to pick them out one by one, I decided to try this. I just did my arms and legs. You do have to go over some areas more than once, but the hair is gone. Even the fuzzies. The only area it hurt alot was my feet and toes. I will definitely continue to use this and may quit shaving altogether. I wish I had gotten this sooner!
customer_reviews.author: L A C

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work on fine hair
customer_reviews.text: Years ago, I had one that looked quite similar to this one. My old one was amazing - used it once every month or so. This one is not nearly as effective. This one breaks off hair rather than pulling it out. I do have fine hair, but did not have this problem with my old one (can't remember the brand). Disappointing -- and the return window expired before I realized it was no good for me. Oh well.
customer_reviews.author: Lawyer For JusticeTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Recomend 100%
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the for years now and it get the job done, I bought this in 2016 it's now 2020 and I would use this little puppy 2 times a month for 4 years, am purchasing a new one just because the power cord is broken. Recomend 100% Oh regarding pain: I have a high tolerance so it was no painful for me but my sister said the first to third time was really painful for her but the more she used it the painless it becomes.
customer_reviews.author: pr!ttyk!tty

customer_reviews.title: Great Device
customer_reviews.text: I have done laser hair removal for years now, and still do perhaps once year for maintenance, but in between I decided to buy an epilator, as plucking keeps the hair growth at bay, where is shaving, gets them grow thicker and plentiful, not to mention the fact that I would have to do it daily. Use it under arms, bikini, and legs once every few weeks. The hair grows fine and very soft, barely noticeable. Definitely money saver in comparison to laser treatment sessions every 2 months... especially for such a small amount of hair I have left on my body.
customer_reviews.author: Delux360

customer_reviews.title: Hurts but it works.
customer_reviews.text: It does hurt, but you get used to it. No more painful than plucking/tweezing. It is fast and leaves my legs smooth. I have also tried it on my armpits and like how smooth it leaves my skin. The pain takes a bit getting used to but it's not too bad. Also I use witch hazel on my skin after to close up my pores and reduce the sting. The first time I used it I got red bumps on my legs but it didn't happen the other times. This one has two speeds and it is laud. I like that you plug it in and do not have to worry about batteries, the cord is long too.
customer_reviews.author: 99.9% Online Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I've had. Not because the first one broke, but because I wore it out. The old one was about 10 years old and just finally died on me. What I didn't realize is how much the old one hurt because it wasn't working well. My fault, not the products. When I opened the new one up and used it, I was soooo happy. Granted, ripping your hair out at the root is going to hurt no matter what! But it didn't feel as bad as I was anticipating. Very smooth motion and it grasp the hair tightly, even on hair shorter than the recommended length. Would recommend to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as described. Manual says "for legs only"
customer_reviews.text: This product works as described. Does it hurt? It's pulling out hairs so yeah...but I'm used to it, so not really. I like that the head is removable and rinse-able. Not crazy that it's for legs only. I don't know a lot about epilators in detail, so I'm going to guess that this is good for coarser hair and not more delicate fine hair (like face). Not sure why it wouldn't be good for underarms, etc. but since I only need it for legs, I'm good.
customer_reviews.author: S. ElleTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Cute And Handy
customer_reviews.text: okay so its been a few weeks using this item. I was hopeing it would help with strawberry legs and I can see a tiny improvement but not much. It does hurts when you start off but like many reviews says you'll get use to the feeling. Easy to handle. Not to easy to clean. Ship rather quickly. If i see more results I'll post up pics i got a before pic ready just waiting for a good result after pic.
customer_reviews.author: Jazz

customer_reviews.title: I thought it worked great at first but I ended up throwing it away ...
customer_reviews.text: I thought it worked great at first but I ended up throwing it away after it kept constantly stopping as I was using it. It did not pull all the hairs out. I had to keep going over the same spot. Looking for another brand!
customer_reviews.author: Anita H

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and works well.
customer_reviews.text: Ive always wanted an epilator but didn't know which ones to buy. I did some researched and came across this one. My leg hair is really thick and I swear when I shave, my hairs will grow back that same night. When I received the epilator I used it immediately. It was painful the first time I admit but that didn't stop me from not trying again. I went over my legs again the next morning and wasn't as bad as the first day. You have to use it a few times to get used to it. I think this is the best investment I have bought. I don't know why I didn't buy this sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Justlynn

customer_reviews.title: Hair removal made easy on a budget!
customer_reviews.text: I love this epilator. I purchased this one to replace the Remington one I had for about 15 years after the cord had issues. This Philips one is smaller and I like that (easier to hold) but does have less tweezers. It still does a great job. If you are a sensitive person and can’t even tweeze your eyebrows, this is NOT for you. I didn’t use my old one for my legs but this is a dream. Personally, it’s my favorite underarm hair removal method. Lasts much longer and no dark “dot” look left behind. Oh and use the pink guide attachment to spare your skin more. 😉
customer_reviews.author: Lou

customer_reviews.title: First timer-- Worked GREAT
customer_reviews.text: First time using and epilator. I am used to waxing my body, but since I am on Accutane, I have to find a different method of hair removal. Decided to try this epilator and I LOVE it. Used it first on my underarms. It stung a bit, but was not unbearable. Felt gutsy and decided to go for my bikini area. I'm used to waxing down there and following up with some tweezer maintenance so the pain was very tolerable. In fact, it worked so well, I was able to go full brazilian! Needless to say, I might never go and get waxed again. Such a time and money saver!
customer_reviews.author: Sandy W.

customer_reviews.title: Over and over and over but the result:  ehh!!
customer_reviews.text: In general epilation is painful process but this epilator makes it triple hard. 3mm should be enough long for any epilator to take the hair out but this one cannot for its first time. You should go over three or four time for one place. It holds the hair but cannot take it out. So you feel the pain three or four times to get hairless result. I think it also brakes the hair. So you can see hair again in two days. I have had older version of braun in my country but I did not bring it to USA because of voltage differences. I am pretty sure that it is better than this epilator. I am very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Nuray

customer_reviews.title: Want to know what true torture feels like? Then buy this!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking that hair removal will officially be a breeze, but boy WAS I WRONG! This thing makes waxing look like a walk in the park. I swear was make by Satan himself, grabbing few hair strands by its multiple metal claws and PLUCKING IT WITH NO REMORSE! And please, if your body, leg or underarm hair is fair/thick and lengthy, you can hang it up, you will scream, you will cry, and you will want to pay for that $80 waxing treatment for the easy way out... On the bright side, you ever want to torture or prank your friends in a slow and extremely painful way, definitely buy this, they won't forget it!
customer_reviews.author: Terry Allen

customer_reviews.title: Good for legs, easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve never owned an epilator before and most people I talk to about them don’t even know what one is! 😁 Easy to use but takes a while to get all the hairs pulled out of one area. Ankles and knees are the hardest. Hurts like hel* the first couple times but I think I’m starting to get used to it. When the hair grows back and I get a chill, the pores on my legs hurt. Don’t try on your pits. Mine bled and it was very painful. Bikini are is super sensitive too. I would stick to waxing those areas.
customer_reviews.author: Shaina Cusick

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a Wahl epilator which had gotten slow and started cutting in and out despite replacing the power adaptor. This is only my second ever epilator but I was nicely surprised. This is more powerful and does faster, more precise hair removal, than my Wahl epilator ever did - even when it was new. I do agree with the other reviewers who mentioned that it is noisy. It is a bit louder than my other epilator, but I really don't mind because it works so well for me. I am happy I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: CS

customer_reviews.title: Great item
customer_reviews.text: Love it works great just as good as the high brand name one but for way less . this is my third hair removal product. First one was chargeable no cord did not last long. Then died. 2nd one made sure it was a crowded one worked so much better. Then died each one last about a year or so. Now just got my tried one of e red the less expensive one since I know I will kill it too. Works great on my hair type I am German . American Indian so think highly hairs get ripped right out. Yes pain but beaty is pain and deal with it Nancy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best pain of my life
customer_reviews.text: I turned to plucking my leg hairs when I was tired of getting a five o'clock shadow and razor burn every time I shaved. It hurt a lot, but my god this hurts way worse. I love it though and I don't even care about the pain. Yeah it's taken me a week to complete both legs, but it's so worth it. My legs actually look smooth now, instead of like prickly cacti. I love my legs now. If you have super thick, dark leg hair like me, you'll be in love too. Just push through that pain, homegirl.
customer_reviews.author: Hpix

customer_reviews.title: This is pretty painful , but it works !
customer_reviews.text: Pretty awesome for the price , and even though its extremely painful and took time getting used to, it is way better than shaving since it leave my skin undamaged , but it does take time to get all the hairs off so you have to go over the same area over and over again but it works the best on under arms .
customer_reviews.author: DiboraK

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Okay so I was so excited to buy an epilator because i am tired of razor or expensive waxing session. I read lot of reviews on amazon and on youtube too and decided to buy philips epilator. It is as painful as waxing but really worth. I mean, its been a week since I used and do not have any grown hair, no itching. I think by the time you continue using it the pain reduces as you get used to of it. Great price and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Ms Lisa K. Nuckolls

customer_reviews.title: Forget shaving!! EPILATE
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this for about 1.5 years now and it’s the best gift I’ve ever received. I love it so much that I bought one for my friend!! I’m a hairy person and I haaaate shaving every day or every other day but ever since I started epilating, I really only have to do hair removal stuff maybe once every two weeks? Depending on if I have an event to go to. My hair grows back exponentially slower and much less noticeable! It definitely hurt at first but after that I’ve become basically numb to the pain. LOVE LOVE LOVE
customer_reviews.author: Megan Chou

customer_reviews.title: Ow ow ow ow ow.
customer_reviews.text: Ok.. yeah, it does the trick. But holy crap. I think I ripped part of my leg off. I have used this thing like four times, just to do two legs, and I get nauseated thinking about using it again. I need a stiff drink before I can muster up the courage to pull it out. But yeah, it works great. Was fairly hairless for about a week, and then everything grew back super soft and thin so it wasn't bad. Just take it from me and take three shots of everclear before using.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For Me
customer_reviews.text: I love this epilator. It makes my skin soft. The reason why i bought one, is because my previous one stoped working after 10 years of use. I'm so happy to have this epilator and greatful to AMAZON for selling it for so cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Elena

customer_reviews.title: Best investment for summertime legs (that won’t break your bank)
customer_reviews.text: Does it hurt like hell the first time. Yes. But after that your skin is used to it and it isn’t nearly as painful. Totally worth it not to have a 5 o’cloclean shadow hours after shaving. And the hair stays gone for a couple of weeks. It doesn’t leave perfectly smooth legs but a good exfoliation before and a razor after use makes for summer-ready legs for far less than you’d pay to have hair ripped off at a salon. Love this product! I wish I started using it years ago!
customer_reviews.author: Cella

customer_reviews.title: Quicker than tweezing, less scary than waxing!
customer_reviews.text: It is, of course, painful! I have excess testosterone and it causes me to grow patches of courser-than-average hair on my face, neck, chest, etc. So far I've tried it on my neck, chin, chest, and upper lip and it wasn't as tough for me as waxing and not as time consuming as tweezing. Upper lip was the most painful, and I couldn't manage to do it in one go.
customer_reviews.author: Parker

customer_reviews.title: Love it, but.....
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only used this product once so far and I love it but. . . It left my legs with lots of bumps and ingrown hairs when my hair started growing back. However it did leave my under arms silky smooth with no bumps or ingrown hairs. I looked up ingrown hair remedies for people that use epilator’s so I’m going to try out some of those tricks on my next use and see if that helps. Overall I’m satisfied and happy with this product and will continue using. It’s way less time-consuming than waxing and less messier too.
customer_reviews.author: Latasha Princess Joyce

customer_reviews.title: Works but it hurts!
customer_reviews.text: Ok so this works... but it fing hurts! You need a gift of pain tolerance for the first time you give this a go! I have shaved since I was a teenager and I have thick dark hair. I have waxed before but it is expensive. I was looking for something to think my hair out. First time I tried this I was swearing the whole time and had to use it in sessions. I have sensitive skin and it did cause ingrown hairs for me a few days later. I said strew it and bought a wax machine not long after. Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Finally, one that works!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful little hair removal tool. For me, the first use was a little painful. TOTALLY WORTH IT! It was a ton of hair. I did both of my entire legs and went the whole way on my nethers. It pulls out the hairs, so zero stubble. Since that first time, I hardly feel it at all. My husband loves it and remarks often on how soft I am everywhere without stubble. In the winter, I use it every 2 weeks. During shorts seasons, once a week. The hair grows back finer and I haven't needed to shave in between. So very happy that I finally found something that works exactly like it advertises on hair removal.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Banchero

customer_reviews.title: Does a good job.
customer_reviews.text: Does what it's suppose to do. Some hairs require multiple tries, but overall it gets them out. Not to painful, about the same as plucking with tweezers, just alot more at once. I use it on my face, no redness, swelling or other issues. I'm happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jody

customer_reviews.title: NOT for sensitive skin
customer_reviews.text: I handled all the ink I've had tattooed on me over the years with no problems. This unit was the most excruciating thing I've ever experienced. Not to mention, it didn't actually PULL the hair out...it just pulled and broke the hairs. If you have sensitive skin, this is NOT the product for you. Think about someone putting dull micro razor blades on sand paper...and just run it across your skin. Then rub sand into the wounds...that's what this feels like.
customer_reviews.author: Kyt Willberg

customer_reviews.title: Used/Opened and Returned Item!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if the product itself is good as the company who sent it clearly gave me an opened and returned one. The box is scuffed. And the best part? Someone has literally written, "some parts missing" on the back.
customer_reviews.author: Reythe

customer_reviews.title: piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 16 year old teen daughter based on all these good reviews on Amazon but the devise is really piece of junk. It does misses to clean and remove all her underarm hair and leaves bruises and marks on her skin. My experience with this devise makes me very skeptical about all the positive reviews on Amazon!!! wondering are they all valid or the company is paying professional review writers to boost up their sales?
customer_reviews.author: Sami

customer_reviews.title: God Sent Device..A must have if you hate bodily hair..
customer_reviews.text: By far the best way to remove unwanted hair. I have PCOS so due to this condition i get a lot of hair growth, but this machine is like god sent. Was slightly painful to use on my first attempt as i have been shaving for years and the hair growth was very thick, but i dont feel any pain now as the hair growing back is so thin and scattered. Only use this machine every 3-4 weeks as supposed to shaving every 24hrs. It has dramatically reduced the amount of hair growing back and rate. Just amazing machine!! I used it for every body part possible.
customer_reviews.author: WorldTraveller

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Easy clean!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for myself for Christmas last year and have liked the results so well that I got one for my stepmom for her birthday this year! Mine is still going strong and does exactly what it needs to do! I've used it on peach fuzz on my face, under arms, legs and bikini line. It hurts the most the very first time because it's never as thick as the first time. Baby powder helps to dry out under arms and tender places.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Finally, the solution for underarm hair!
customer_reviews.text: Are there better devices? Probably... but for $30? Probably not! I have been searching for solutions for my dark underarm hair and I think this is it! I HIGHLY recommend getting waxed a few times first, the hair will already be coming in thinner after a few cycles. Waxing hurts and is expensive and you have to grow it out way long to go! I knew this wasn't realistic or sustainable, so I'm glad I found this thing. Cheaper than a single wax... The first time was rough! Not going to lie... but I tweezed any outliers and I've used it a hand full of times now and it has gotten much more tolerable.
customer_reviews.author: Carly Parkins

customer_reviews.title: Worth the buy, say no to shaving.
customer_reviews.text: My last one lasted 3+ years. I think it was time to replace it because I dropped it so many times. I believe I damaged it but it still worked pretty well. Not for sensitive skin because it is painful but I love it. I use about once a month for my legs and arm pits because my hair is so thin now thanks to epilating! I wish the cord was longer that’s my only dislike. Worth the buy I no longer shave!
customer_reviews.author: Yesenia

customer_reviews.title: Works but not the best
customer_reviews.text: This thing hurts like crazy! However, the hair stays away for much longer than shaving, and it isn't near as messy as waxing. The pain lessens each time you use it (Unless you neglect it quite a while and let your hair grow, then it hurts again). This model doesn't quite take the hair off as fast as I'd like, but it does work. Hair gets stuck in the spinners underneath the tweezer head. It also has to be connected to power while being used, so you have to stay near an electrical outlet. Depending on how long your hair is, you may also need to vacuum afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: Lilith Wolfersberger

customer_reviews.title: Worth Buying and Safe for Sensitive Skin
customer_reviews.text: I bought this epilator few weeks back and i am using it for every 2 weeks.It is making wonders on my skin.I though it will cause some rashes on my skin as i have sensitive skin.But it doesn't and i have realized instead of spending lot of money on waxing it is worth buying of this product one time and can be used as many times you want without effecting the skin.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Already paid for itself!
customer_reviews.text: Great gadget now that we can’t make it to threading/waxing salons. If you are used to waxing/threading than pain is comparable. I only have used on small areas that i normally get waxed like upper lip. I don’t have tons of hair, but it is dark/coarse and having this has been helpful- already paid for itself. Yes, it’s painful- just like waxing or threading would be. Good luck- stay safe!
customer_reviews.author: PJL

customer_reviews.title: Pain, pain, pain!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I figure I am just sensitive, but it is super painful. Also, seems really messy. I used it a few times sitting inside the (dry) tub and there was hair "dust" everywhere and all over the epilator. I found it broke off a lot of the hairs on my legs and didn't really pull out as many. But it hurt either way. Have put it away and will try again later. I also used it a bit on my arm to see how that went. A little less painful, but not fun either.
customer_reviews.author: xxxxx

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 7 years before cord shorted
customer_reviews.text: I'm impressed with how long this has lasted. 7 YEARS. And I'm only looking for a replacement now because the cord has gone bad. Does it hurt? I mean it's yanking your hair out from the root. Imagine really fast plucking. You know your tolerance. For me it's fine on my legs, hurts on my underarms but I can wince through it, bikini area no chance!
customer_reviews.author: Camille

customer_reviews.title: Effective
customer_reviews.text: This product does the job. The process does take awhile, but the results last. I primarily wax, and got this for quarantine. Certain spots can be painful since it is plucking hairs, but it does not last long. Everyone has different pain tolerances and skin types (so your skin could be very red and dry for a day or two after use).
customer_reviews.author: Kimber

customer_reviews.title: Snatched Hair...and Skin
customer_reviews.text: Pros: when successful, it snatches the hair from the root and leaves skin baby soft. You will bump up after but once it calms down by the next day, skin is smooth and baby soft Cons: it was difficult to use, I Googled, read reviews and watched multiple YouTube videos to figure out how to use it effectively and what angle to put it against my face yet still managed to rip my skin off in the process. The next day I had a scab/burn mark and then the skin peeled off. I am very torn on whether this device is worth keeping. I’m now seeing hairs grow back in (6-7 days later).
customer_reviews.author: Brittany D

customer_reviews.title: If you enjoy pain and have hours to kill...
customer_reviews.text: I guess this sort of works. It feels like a tattoo, if your tattoo needle were 2 inches wide and took 10-12 passes to do its job. It was definitely pulling out some hair, but not nearly all of it. I currently have a 2-inch wide, flaming red, stinging like fire strip of reasonably smooth, irritated skin up my shin, but it took 15 minutes to get it. I would be fine with the pain if there were other benefits to this over shaving, but I just don't have the hours it would take to find out. Better luck to you.
customer_reviews.author: stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Death by a thousand papercuts.
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this epilator once, but I really like it. I've been waxing for a few years, but it's a messy hassle. This guy was more efficient, grabbed shorter hair, and was way less involved. It also hurt. A lot. Not worse than waxing, but definitely more prolonged. The shorter hair in my armpits, and fine blond hairs on my arms were less ouchie, so I'm definitely going to be careful not to get too lazy about keeping up with it. 🤣
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: It’s definitely painful! Feels like burning or scraping
customer_reviews.text: This was my first time epilating, and holy sh!% did I think I was going to die when I first started. It’s definitely painful! Feels like burning or scraping, but after a little while it’s not as bad. If you can stand it though, it works wonders! I did both legs and it did the job, a little red and bumpy but hoping from other reviews this goes away in a day. It’s been 4 hours and it looks better already. Hoping this gets easier and less painful the more often I use it.
customer_reviews.author: BasmatiBurner

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect but...very good.
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I like it. It works as it should but...it is very strong and since I have sensitive skin, it takes some getting use. It caused me to have break outs the first couple of weeks. However after awhile, it has been very good and definitely gets the job done. You can not use this without plugging in the cord which can be a pain. It would be nice to have an option. Overall, this is a good product and compared to other products where I have to change the batteries constantly...it's good and worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: TY

customer_reviews.title: Nice epilator
customer_reviews.text: I have sensitive skin and I have had no problem using it on my legs, hands, and underarms as well. Some redness is normal after epilation but no prolonged redness, irritation and inflammation. The head fixture troubles me sometimes when I am holding it, I kind of tend to remove it or unclick it. Given the price, Philips could have made it wireless which would be way easier.
customer_reviews.author: AShrestha

customer_reviews.title: So worth it
customer_reviews.text: This is a game changer. Yes it hurts. It’s ripping your hair out but sooooo worth the smooth skin after. There’s no mess, it’s cheap and the results are long lasting. I couldn’t handle it on my armpits - too painful there but that’s a quick shave. I have seen terrific results on my legs and bikini line.
customer_reviews.author: Frankie101

customer_reviews.title: Only high pain tolerances should order.
customer_reviews.text: I have a love/hate relationship with this epilator. Its like you're inflicting torture on yourself - The first time I did used it - it took me about 4 hours to go over my legs. I have never had children, but I think that would be less painful that what I experienced with this Epilator. Imagine - its basically plucking each individual hair out like a tweezer, but bunches at a time. The good news - the pain gets better. Every time you do it, it gets a little easier - its just getting there. And once you do it - you get a good 2-3 weeks before you have to do it again.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Did not work well for me.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this eplilator because it has very good review for a long time. I wanted to buy it since when I was in college. Finally bought and tried it bjt I did not like it. My hair is not thick at all and it did not remove the hair completely. It did not leave the satin finish. I would stick to the waxing.
customer_reviews.author: Ariuk

customer_reviews.title: No as good as I expected
customer_reviews.text: I used to have another brand but it gets bad so I ordered this couple months ago, but it doesn’t work as I was expecting, I have to use it several times in my skin to get results and also I got a severe irritation on my face, it’s not smooth and definitely I will get another brand next time, it’s just so frustrated that I have to use it so many times to see results and I spend double of time that I used to spend with the others ones.
customer_reviews.author: Ivonne Valencia

customer_reviews.title: Not for 99%
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this, I tried it twice so as not to judge too harshly... BUT; it’s noisy, you need to go over the same spot at least 3x and it hurts even more than I could have possible imagined (and I can handle almost any pain). I would rate it less but it does “work”. I will not be continuing to use it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Kaio

customer_reviews.title: Best price, best epilator
customer_reviews.text: For the price and quality, you can't go wrong with this. I also have to Braun water proof epilator, and I always go back to this one because it is the most powerful and actually pulls all the hairs. The price point is really nice too so I just buy a new one once the old one gets too used. The only thing is I wish we could buy replacement heads instead of replacing the whole thing cuz it kind of seems like a waste to have to buy the whole thing again
customer_reviews.author: Brittney Ann

customer_reviews.title: nice conpromise between shaving and waxing
customer_reviews.text: I've enjoyed using this so far -- i can't recommend using it on an area that hasn't been recently shaved, I suggest using it to address regrowth rather than just ploughing straight into the grass that hasn't been mowed in a month. Beyond that, it's really convenient to be able to remove hair in the comfort of my bedroom while watching and listening to other stuff, and without running any water. It's also reassuring that plucked hair will take longer to come back than shaved hair. The pain is enough to be worth mentioning, but manageable
customer_reviews.author: Big Chungus

customer_reviews.title: I can’t lie that didn’t hurt but I had some time that I only use razors and the hair was pretty strong but he did an amazing job and today ...
customer_reviews.text: Hello, here! This cute guy is Worth all the money. I can’t lie that didn’t hurt but I had some time that I only use razors and the hair was pretty strong but he did an amazing job and today i’m All soft. I used on my legs, arms, chin and mustache and I’m ok. Be careful if you know your skin is sensitive don’t use it on your face. Mine looks bad for the first day but next day is perfect. I always use post epilation cream. My only issue is that he makes a lot of noise, but for the money I paid I can’t ask for more. He is efficient!
customer_reviews.author: Maholea Camelia Elena

customer_reviews.title: Painful but hilarious to watch
customer_reviews.text: My sister got this and I’ve watched her use it a couple times. It is hilarious watching her because it hurts so bad and she tries to not let it hurt her. I tried it once too. It feels like a ton of tweezers pulling at your hairs at once and quickly. I would never be able to use one of these...supposedly it gets easier every time you use it, but she can’t get herself to do more than a two inch patch at a time.
customer_reviews.author: sydney

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t work like it says, I don’t understand why so many positive reviews, I have been using it for 8 months and haven’t seen any different in shaving or using this epilation. I don’t recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Value buy
customer_reviews.text: Whether it hurts or not depends on your skin. If you're used to getting certain areas plucked or waxed then this could work well. I also heard that with practice, you can grow more tolerant to the pain. The device is a bit loud but it gets the job done. I like that you don't need to replace batteries, and don't need to use a razor. Just need to wash the head and cap to stay hygienic. Will be saving a LOT of money in the long run. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Bethany Kwong

customer_reviews.title: Alright.
customer_reviews.text: This product is alright. It’s the cheapest epilator I could find, but I suppose you get what you pay for. It works alright but I do have to go over areas anywhere from 3-6 times typically to make sure it gets all the hairs, and if you’re doing a larger part of your body such as legs the device itself will heat up sometimes to the point of you having to pause and let it cool down then resume. If you can afford a more expensive epilator i think it would be a worthwhile investment, but this one does work alright!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the pain
customer_reviews.text: The first few minutes the anticipation was killing me and the first actual time I put it on my leg and pulled some hair out, it hurt! Then I got used to it. I haven’t been able to do the knee or above yet. It worked great, my legs are smooth, it feels like I waxed them. I had not shaved in 10 weeks so my hair was long. It have no complaints. Well worth the pain and the price.
customer_reviews.author: Desiree S

product_meta.title: Philips Beauty HP6401/50 Satinelle Essential, Compact Hair Removal Epilator for Legs
product_meta.description: Style Name:EpilatorPhilips Satinelle epilator gives you soft, smooth skin. Unlike disposable razors or depilatories, Philips Satinelle epilator removes hair from the roots and is gentle on your skin. Complete with two speed settings and an ergonomic grip for comfortable handling, this epilation system removes hair as short as 0.5 millimeter. The 21 hypoallergenic discs and a removable, washable head ensure a hygienic hair removal experience.
feature_bullets: Satinelle corded compact epilator removes hair from legs: leaves skin smooth for weeks and saves money versus salon waxing
Efficiently removes even the shortest hairs (up to 0.5 millimeter) from the root, though epilation is easier and more comfortable when hair is 3 to 4 millimeter
Corded design for non stop use on dry skin: Epilating dry skin is preferred for its efficiency and picking up more hairs on the first pass
2 speed settings: uses lower speed in combination with efficiency cap attachment on more delicate or hard to reach areas of the body
Washable epilation head: easy to remove and clean with water for optimal hygiene. Voltage 100 to 240 V

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
